summary.purpose: Provides a comprehensive set of searchable command/command palette components built on the cmdk library, including command dialog, input, list, grouping, and item components with consistent styling and keyboard navigation.
summary.problem_solved: Simplifies building accessible command palettes and searchable lists by wrapping the cmdk library with pre-styled components, integrating with Radix UI Dialog, and providing composable sub-components for structure, search filtering, and item selection.

external.name: cmdk
external.why_used: Provides the Command primitive library for building accessible command/search interfaces with built-in filtering and keyboard navigation

external.name: react
external.why_used: Core React library for component creation, forwardRef, and JSX rendering

external.name: lucide-react
external.why_used: Provides the Search icon for command input

external.name: @radix-ui/react-dialog
external.why_used: Provides Dialog primitives for CommandDialog component

internal.why_used: Provides the cn() utility function for conditionally merging CSS classes
Provides Dialog, DialogContent, DialogDescription, and DialogTitle for CommandDialog

exports.name: Command
exports.description_one_line: Root command component wrapping cmdk's Command primitive

exports.name: CommandDialog
exports.description_one_line: Dialog-wrapped command component for modal command palettes

exports.name: CommandInput
exports.description_one_line: Searchable input field with optional search icon for filtering command items

exports.name: CommandList
exports.description_one_line: Scrollable list container for command groups and items

exports.name: CommandEmpty
exports.description_one_line: Message displayed when no command items match the search filter

exports.name: CommandGroup
exports.description_one_line: Container for grouping related command items with optional heading

exports.name: CommandSeparator
exports.description_one_line: Visual separator between command groups or items

exports.name: CommandItem
exports.description_one_line: Individual selectable command item with keyboard and mouse interaction

exports.name: CommandShortcut
exports.description_one_line: Keyboard shortcut display element for command items

symbols.name: Command
symbols.description_one_line: Root command component wrapping cmdk's Command primitive with consistent styling

params.name: className
params.description: Optional CSS classes to merge with default command styles

params.name: ...props
params.description: All standard cmdk Command props (value, onValueChange, filter, etc.)

returns.description: A styled command container with full-height flex layout

details.what_it_does: Renders the root command container using cmdk's CommandPrimitive. Pre-styled with flex column layout, full height, rounded borders, popover background color, and foreground text color. Uses forwardRef for direct access to the underlying command element. Serves as the main wrapper for all command sub-components.
details.rendered_ui_description: A full-height flex container with rounded corners, popover background, and text foreground color. Vertical flex layout for stacking input, list, empty states, and items. Overflow hidden to ensure content fits within rounded borders.

minimal_correct.title: Basic command with input and list

extensive_correct.title: Command with groups, separators, and empty state
extensive_correct.code:
import { Command, CommandInput, CommandList, CommandEmpty, CommandGroup, CommandItem, CommandSeparator } from 'akeyless-client-commons/components/ui';

const AdvancedCommand = () => (
  <Command>
    <CommandInput placeholder="Search actions..." />
    <CommandList>
      <CommandEmpty>No results found</CommandEmpty>
      <CommandGroup heading="Recent">
        <CommandItem value="recent-1">Recent Action 1</CommandItem>
        <CommandItem value="recent-2">Recent Action 2</CommandItem>
      </CommandGroup>
      <CommandSeparator />
      <CommandGroup heading="Other">
        <CommandItem value="other-1">Other Action 1</CommandItem>
        <CommandItem value="other-2">Other Action 2</CommandItem>
      </CommandGroup>
    </CommandList>
  </Command>
);

incorrect.title: Incorrect: Command with only input
incorrect.why_incorrect: A command component should have at least CommandInput and CommandList to be functional. Without a list, there's nowhere to display searchable items.

symbols.name: CommandDialog
symbols.description_one_line: Command component wrapped in a Dialog for modal command palettes

params.name: children
params.description: Command sub-components (CommandInput, CommandList, CommandGroup, etc.)

params.name: ...props
params.description: All Dialog props (open, onOpenChange, etc.)

returns.description: A styled dialog containing a command component

details.what_it_does: Renders a command component inside a Radix UI Dialog. Automatically manages dialog state and styling. Includes temporary DialogTitle and DialogDescription elements to suppress console warnings. Removes the dialog's default close button via CSS selector. Customizes the command styling for dialog layout with max-width sm:max-w-lg.
details.rendered_ui_description: A modal dialog with centered positioning, overlay, and a command palette inside. The command area is full-width within the dialog with no padding. Includes input, groups, items, and empty state, all styled for dialog context.

minimal_correct.title: Basic command dialog with trigger

extensive_correct.title: Command dialog with keyboard shortcut to open

incorrect.title: Incorrect: CommandDialog without input
incorrect.why_incorrect: CommandDialog should contain CommandInput and CommandList for proper command palette functionality. Without these, the dialog won't have searchable command functionality.

symbols.name: CommandInput
symbols.description_one_line: Searchable input field for filtering command items with optional search icon

params.name: className
params.description: Optional CSS classes to merge with default input styles

params.name: withSearchIcon
params.description: Whether to display a search icon to the left of the input. Defaults to false.

params.name: ...props
params.description: All standard input props (placeholder, type, value, onChange, etc.)

returns.description: A styled input field with optional search icon

details.what_it_does: Renders cmdk's CommandPrimitive.Input with pre-styled wrapper. The wrapper includes a border-bottom and horizontal padding. Optionally displays a Search icon from lucide-react to the left of the input. The input itself is full-width, transparent background, with placeholder text in muted color. Supports all standard input attributes. Uses forwardRef for direct input element access.
details.rendered_ui_description: A single-line input field with bottom border only, horizontal padding, and muted foreground text. Optional search icon appears to the left with muted-foreground color. Input text is small font size (text-sm) on transparent background. Disabled state reduces opacity.

extensive_correct.title: Input with search icon and custom styling
extensive_correct.code:
<Command>
  <CommandInput 
    placeholder="Type command name..." 
    withSearchIcon
    className="text-base"
  />
  <CommandList>
    {/* items */}
  </CommandList>
</Command>

incorrect.title: Incorrect: CommandInput value prop without onChange
incorrect.why_incorrect: If you set the value prop, you must provide an onChange handler. Otherwise, the input will appear frozen and unable to accept user input. Either remove the value prop for uncontrolled mode or add onChange handler for controlled mode.

symbols.name: CommandList
symbols.description_one_line: Scrollable container for command groups and items

params.name: className
params.description: Optional CSS classes to merge with default list styles

params.name: ...props
params.description: All standard cmdk List props

details.what_it_does: Renders cmdk's CommandPrimitive.List with pre-configured max-height and scrolling behavior. Max-height is set to 80 (320px). Scrolls vertically (overflow-y-auto) and hides horizontal overflow. Uses forwardRef for direct access to the list element.
details.rendered_ui_description: A scrollable container with max-height of 320px, vertical scrollbar when content exceeds height, hidden horizontal scroll. Displays CommandGroup, CommandSeparator, CommandEmpty, and CommandItem children.

extensive_correct.title: List with multiple groups and separators
extensive_correct.code:
<CommandList>
  <CommandGroup heading="Frequently Used">
    <CommandItem value="home">Go Home</CommandItem>
    <CommandItem value="settings">Settings</CommandItem>
  </CommandGroup>
  <CommandSeparator />
  <CommandGroup heading="Other Actions">
    <CommandItem value="logout">Logout</CommandItem>
  </CommandGroup>
</CommandList>

incorrect.title: Incorrect: Empty CommandList
incorrect.why_incorrect: An empty CommandList should display CommandEmpty component to inform users that there are no results. Without it, users see nothing when filtering produces no results.

symbols.name: CommandEmpty
symbols.description_one_line: Message displayed when no command items match the search filter

details.what_it_does: Renders cmdk's CommandPrimitive.Empty component with centered text styling. Displays when no items match the current search filter. Pre-styled with vertical padding, centered text alignment, and small font size. Uses forwardRef for element access.

extensive_correct.title: Descriptive empty state with guidance
extensive_correct.code:
No results found

Try searching with different keywords

 {/* items */}

incorrect.title: Incorrect: CommandEmpty outside CommandList
incorrect.why_incorrect: CommandEmpty must be inside CommandList. If placed outside, it will always display even when items are present.

symbols.name: CommandGroup
symbols.description_one_line: Container for grouping related command items with optional heading

params.name: heading
params.description: Text or element to display as the group heading

params.name: className
params.description: Optional CSS classes to merge with default group styles

params.name: ...props
params.description: All standard cmdk Group props

returns.description: A styled group container with optional heading

details.what_it_does: Renders cmdk's CommandPrimitive.Group with overflow hidden, padding, and foreground text color. Pre-styles group headings with horizontal padding, vertical padding, small font size, medium weight, and muted-foreground color. Organizes related items into visually distinct groups. Uses forwardRef for element access.
details.rendered_ui_description: A container with padding that groups related items. Optional heading appears at the top with small gray text (text-xs, font-medium, muted-foreground). Items inside group are displayed below heading.

extensive_correct.title: Multiple groups with separators
extensive_correct.code:
<CommandList>
  <CommandGroup heading="Recent">
    <CommandItem value="recent-1">Recent Item 1</CommandItem>
    <CommandItem value="recent-2">Recent Item 2</CommandItem>
  </CommandGroup>
  <CommandSeparator />
  <CommandGroup heading="Suggestions">
    <CommandItem value="sug-1">Suggested Item 1</CommandItem>
    <CommandItem value="sug-2">Suggested Item 2</CommandItem>
  </CommandGroup>
</CommandList>

incorrect.title: Incorrect: CommandGroup without heading
incorrect.why_incorrect: While groups without headings work, headings help organize related items visually. Always include a heading to make command structure clear to users.

symbols.name: CommandSeparator
symbols.description_one_line: Visual separator line between command groups or items

details.what_it_does: Renders cmdk's CommandPrimitive.Separator as a thin horizontal line. Pre-styled with negative horizontal margin, 1px height, and border color. Uses forwardRef for element access.

extensive_correct.title: Multiple separators for visual hierarchy
extensive_correct.code:
<CommandList>
  <CommandGroup heading="Recent">
    <CommandItem value="rec-1">Recent 1</CommandItem>
  </CommandGroup>
  <CommandSeparator />
  <CommandGroup heading="Actions">
    <CommandItem value="act-1">Action 1</CommandItem>
  </CommandGroup>
  <CommandSeparator />
  <CommandGroup heading="Settings">
    <CommandItem value="set-1">Setting 1</CommandItem>
  </CommandGroup>
</CommandList>

incorrect.title: Incorrect: Too many separators
incorrect.why_incorrect: Excessive separators clutter the interface. Use separators between groups, not between individual items.

symbols.name: CommandItem
symbols.description_one_line: Individual selectable command item with keyboard and mouse interaction

params.name: value
params.description: Unique identifier for the item, passed to onSelect and used for filtering

params.name: onSelect
params.description: Callback fired when item is selected via keyboard or mouse click

params.name: disabled
params.description: Whether the item is disabled and cannot be selected

params.name: className
params.description: Optional CSS classes to merge with default item styles

params.name: children
params.description: Item content (text, icons, elements)

params.name: ...props
params.description: All standard cmdk Item props

details.what_it_does: Renders cmdk's CommandPrimitive.Item with pre-configured styling for selection and disabled states. Displays as a flex row with gap-3 spacing. Selected state shows accent background and accent-foreground text. Disabled state reduces opacity. SVG icons inside are non-interactive and shrunk. Supports keyboard navigation (arrow keys, enter) and mouse selection. Uses forwardRef for element access.
details.rendered_ui_description: A row item with horizontal padding, vertical padding, rounded corners, and flex gap. Normal state shows popover/background foreground colors. Selected state highlights with accent background and contrasting text. Disabled items appear grayed out. Icons are automatically styled and don't interfere with item selection.

extensive_correct.title: Item with icon and disabled state
extensive_correct.code: search()}> Search Disabled Action action()}> Action Cmd K

incorrect.title: Incorrect: Item without value
incorrect.why_incorrect: Every CommandItem MUST have a unique value prop. The value is used for filtering and selection callbacks. Without it, the item won't function correctly.

symbols.name: CommandShortcut
symbols.description_one_line: Keyboard shortcut display element for command items

params.name: className
params.description: Optional CSS classes to merge with default shortcut styles

params.name: ...props
params.description: All standard HTML span/element attributes

returns.description: A styled keyboard shortcut display element

details.what_it_does: Renders a visual representation of a keyboard shortcut. Displayed as a styled kbd element with border, small background, padding, and muted text color. Positioned on the right side of CommandItem using margin-left auto (ms-auto). Pre-configured styling mimics keyboard key appearance with border, background, and appropriate sizing.
details.rendered_ui_description: A small inline-flex keyboard key icon with border, light background, and dark text. Positioned at the right end of a CommandItem. Used to display keyboard shortcuts like 'Cmd K', 'Ctrl+S', etc.

extensive_correct.title: Multiple items with shortcuts
extensive_correct.code:
<CommandList>
  <CommandItem value="save">
    Save
    <CommandShortcut>Cmd S</CommandShortcut>
  </CommandItem>
  <CommandItem value="find">
    Find
    <CommandShortcut>Cmd F</CommandShortcut>
  </CommandItem>
  <CommandItem value="replace">
    Find & Replace
    <CommandShortcut>Cmd H</CommandShortcut>
  </CommandItem>
</CommandList>

incorrect.title: Incorrect: Shortcut outside CommandItem
incorrect.code:
// Shortcut positioning will be wrong
<CommandList>
  <CommandShortcut>Cmd K</CommandShortcut>
  <CommandItem value="item">Item</CommandItem>
</CommandList>
incorrect.why_incorrect: CommandShortcut should be placed inside CommandItem for correct positioning on the right side. Outside the item, it won't align properly.
